page.title: 19N.G.T.E. PYESTOCK, FLEET
page.content:
The{National Gas Turbine Establishment is the United Kingdom centre for {research}and{development}in{gas {turbine technology.}This work began in 1942, and in 1946, following a merger with Frank Whittle's team, the NGTE was born. The main research done here is on the gas turbine engine for land, sea and air use, but problems such as aircraft noise are also investigated. The work provides employment for many people, the majority of whom are {scientific and technical engineers. }
In July 1985 the numbers employed were as follows:- Scientific Staff 123 Engineers 151 Skilled Industrialists 267 Semi-skilled Industrialists 117 Support Staff 59
